title: Key Research Papers in Quantum Finance

papers.title: Option Pricing using Quantum Computers
key_contributions: First practical framework for option pricing on quantum computers
Combines amplitude estimation with payoff loading
Achieves quadratic speedup over classical Monte Carlo
Demonstrates on European and Asian options
key_findings: Amplitude estimation provides O(1/ε) complexity vs O(1/ε²) classical
Path-dependent options (Asian, barrier) particularly benefit
Current hardware insufficient but 2027-2030 viable
Error mitigation critical for near-term results

formulas.name: Quantum Option Price
formulas.expression: E[f(S_T)] = sin²(πa) where |a⟩ is amplitude encoded in quantum state
formulas.explanation: Option price encoded in probability amplitude, extracted via quantum phase estimation.

papers.trading_relevance: Direct application to exotic option pricing and risk calculation

papers.title: Quantum Risk Analysis
key_contributions: Amplitude estimation for Value at Risk (VaR) and CVaR
Quantum circuit for loss distribution loading
Integration with classical risk frameworks
key_findings: VaR computation achieves quadratic speedup
CVaR (Conditional VaR) also accelerated
Portfolio credit risk analysis demonstrated
Scalable to large portfolios with sufficient qubits
papers.trading_relevance: Direct application to risk management systems

papers.title: A Threshold for Quantum Advantage in Derivative Pricing
key_contributions: Concrete resource estimates for quantum advantage
Comparison of quantum vs classical compute time
Hardware requirements analysis
key_findings: ~7,500 logical qubits needed for practical advantage
Error correction dominates resource requirements
Advantage possible by 2030 on optimistic timeline
Specific problems reach threshold before general advantage
papers.trading_relevance: Sets realistic expectations for quantum trading systems

papers.title: Quantum Algorithms for Portfolio Optimization
key_contributions: Quantum algorithm for mean-variance optimization
Handles cardinality constraints
Integrates with real market data
key_findings: Markowitz optimization mapped to quantum circuit
Integer constraints handled via QAOA
Outperforms classical for large portfolios (1000+ assets)
Practical on near-term devices for small portfolios

formulas.name: Quantum Markowitz
formulas.expression: min_{x} x^T Σ x - μ^T x subject to 1^T x = 1, x ∈ {0,1}^n
formulas.explanation: Binary portfolio optimization encoded as QUBO for quantum solver.

papers.trading_relevance: Direct application to portfolio construction and rebalancing
